areaSection: Calpe is a distinguished Mediterranean coastal municipality in the province of Alicante, renowned for its dramatic geography dominated by the iconic Peñón d'Ifach rock formation. This natural monument creates a distinctive landscape that has attracted discerning residents and investors for decades. The municipality benefits from a temperate Mediterranean climate with approximately 300 days of sunshine annually, making it an ideal year-round residence for those seeking consistent weather and outdoor pursuits. The area's elevation and coastal position create pleasant sea breezes that moderate summer temperatures, whilst winters remain mild and frost-free. Calpe's strategic location between Valencia and Benidorm positions it perfectly for those balancing coastal lifestyle with urban accessibility. The town's development has been carefully managed to preserve its natural character, with the Mascarat area representing one of the most exclusive and architecturally conscious residential zones along this stretch of coast.
lifestyleSection: Living in Calpe means becoming part of a sophisticated international community where British, German, Scandinavian, and Spanish cultures create a uniquely cosmopolitan atmosphere. The strong expatriate presence ensures that English is widely spoken, excellent healthcare with English-speaking practitioners is readily available, and international standards for education, retail, and dining are consistently maintained. Daily life revolves around the exceptional Mediterranean beaches—Arenal-Bol with its Blue Flag status, Cantal Roig, and La Fossa—each offering distinct character and facilities. The town supports a thriving gastronomic scene ranging from fine dining establishments to authentic local restaurants serving Mediterranean cuisine. The weekly markets provide fresh local produce, whilst modern supermarkets like Mercadona and Consum cater to international tastes. For active residents, the nearby Club de Golf Ifach just five minutes away, combined with other prestigious courses within easy reach, ensures golf remains central to the lifestyle. The strong sense of community is complemented by proximity to sophisticated amenities: private healthcare facilities, international schools, cultural activities, and an extensive calendar of events celebrating both Spanish traditions and international festivities.

Rental potential remains attractive, with similar three-bedroom apartments commanding approximately €1,000 per week in summer season and €500-600 in shoulder seasons, generating annual yields of 6-8% from rental income. The property's location in Mascarat, combined with its contemporary specification and three-bedroom configuration, ensures consistent demand from families, couples, and rental holiday operators seeking luxury short-term accommodation. International property investors recognise Costa Blanca's proven performance as an alternative to traditional domestic property markets, whilst the strong expatriate community ensures robust demand for quality residential inventory.

healthcare.text: Healthcare provision in Calpe meets international standards with multiple facilities and English-speaking medical professionals. The Centro de Salud Calp provides primary care and emergency services within minutes of residential areas. The Hospital de Dénia, located 30 minutes away via the regional highway, serves as the primary acute care facility for the district, offering comprehensive specialist services and modern diagnostic facilities. Private healthcare clinics throughout Calpe cater specifically to international residents, employing bilingual staff familiar with British and European medical expectations. Many practitioners have British or international medical qualifications, and healthcare standards consistently meet Northern European expectations. Prescription medications are widely available through numerous pharmacies, with many staff members speaking English. Dental services, optical care, and specialist consultations are readily accessed through private providers, ensuring medical care requirements rarely necessitate travel beyond the immediate region.

education.text: Calpe's education provision caters excellently to international families. Lady Elizabeth School in nearby Cumbre del Sol (10 minutes) provides British curriculum education from early years through secondary, with established reputation for academic excellence and strong pastoral care. Laude Newton College in Benidorm (35 minutes) represents an alternative British-curriculum option with strong university preparation outcomes. Both schools attract international families and employ experienced educators familiar with diverse student backgrounds. Spanish language education is available through local state schools, facilitating integration into the broader community. Numerous private tutoring services support academic development across subjects and languages, whilst music, sports, and enrichment activities are readily available through the strong international community network.

shopping.text: Shopping and grocery provision in Calpe combines modern supermarket convenience with Spanish market authenticity. Mercadona operates multiple locations throughout the town, providing familiar European brands alongside Spanish products at competitive pricing. Consum supermarkets offer comparable range and convenience, whilst Lidl serves budget-conscious shoppers without compromising quality. The weekly markets held in central Calpe present opportunities to purchase fresh local produce directly from farmers and producers, offering authentic Mediterranean experience and significant cost savings. Mas y Mas and other specialist retailers cater to international tastes, stocking imported products familiar to British, German, and Scandinavian communities. The town centre provides independent retailers, bakeries, butchers, and specialist shops, creating vibrant street-level commercial activity typical of Spanish coastal towns.

transport.text: Connectivity and transportation options in Calpe facilitate both local mobility and broader regional access. Alicante-Elche Airport, located 75 minutes south via the AP-7 motorway, provides excellent European connections with direct flights to major British and European cities. Regular bus services connect Calpe to Benidorm (25 minutes) and Valencia (120 minutes), with frequent departures throughout the day. A new TRAM system is planned to enhance public transport connectivity in coming years. Within Calpe, local buses serve residential areas and the town centre, though many residents prefer private vehicles for optimal flexibility. The road network includes modern motorways facilitating swift access to other Costa Blanca destinations. Parking is generally straightforward, with the apartment providing secure parking provisions.
